subject: TONIGHT ON SHOWBIZ TONIGHT - CNN HEADLINE PRIME 11pm ET/PT
body:
CNN.com - Showbiz Tonight










TONIGHT ON SHOWBIZ TONIGHT - CNN HEADLINE PRIME 11pm
ET/PT

A PARIS HILTON SMACKDOWN!
One
of Hollywood's most powerful mothers gives Paris a hard
reality check about going to jail. And even Patty Hearst
has
some choice words for Paris! Yes, that Patty Hearst:
the
newspaper heiress, who was kidnapped, then joined her
captors
to help their cause! The inside story on TV's most
provocative
entertainment news show. 

WILL JAIL
TIME REALLY CHANGE PARIS?
Okay, so she's supposed to
spend up to 45-days in the slammer.
But will making license
plates really give Paris license to
change? A guy who has
followed every dirty detail, every 
Hilton family scandal
doesn't think so. "House of Hilton"
author Jerry
Oppenheimer is right here with his surprising
thoughts on
whether jail will really change Paris.

CELEBRITIES
WHO NEED TO "LIVE THE TRUTH"
Famed TV Psychiatrist Dr.
Keith Ablow has some very powerful
advice for stars who are
in trouble -- yes, we're talking about
you Paris Hilton,
David Hasselhoff, Alec Baldwin and Britney
Spears. Dr.
Ablow reveals why they need to acknowledge their
issues,
and what they need to turn their lives around. 

MUDLE OSMOND'S PAINFUL DECISION
Showbiz Tonight
goes one-on-one with the singing star, who
reveals what she
went through while deciding to end her 20-year
marriage and
opens up about her battle with depression. Her
emotional
interview, only on Showbiz Tonight.

WHY WE THINK WE
KNOW STARS SO WELL
Showbiz Tonight investigates how we
connect to celebrities --
just why do we feel we know them
on a personal level? It's
amazing how much we know about
their personal lives, right? 
Sometimes we feel like they
are our best friends. It's a
Showbiz Tonight Special
Report!

SHOWBIZ TONIGHT QUESTION OF THE DAY:
Paris Hilton: Will she come out of jail a better person?
VOTE AT CNN.COM/SHOWBIZ TONIGHT

SEND US A VIDEO
EMAIL! 
We want to hear your response to the Question
of the Day, or
whatever else is on your mind, on video.
Responses must be no
longer than 30 seconds. To do it, just
head to
cnn.com/showbiztonight Then tune in to see your
video email on
TV!

WATCH SHOWBIZ TONIGHT SEVEN
NIGHTS A WEEK ON CNN HEADLINE
PRIME 11pm ET/PT
